Reviews.Title: “Secure Parking and Close to Metro Station”
Reviews.Author: MindyLePooh
Reviews.Content: We were told our room was one of the "newly renovated" ones, which was ridiculous because everything in the room seemed really old. Carpet was dark and brown and smelled like mildew - I did not dare to take my shoes off. Bathroom was tiny. The shower head was really loose from the wall and felt like it was going to fall off. Every time the heater turned on, a terrible WHEEEEEE whining sound would screech out and wake the dead. The bed felt like a hard plank, totally uncomfortable and my back/hip hurt the next day. The exterior of the front entrance was a messy soggy carpet because there is a low spot there with a drain and all the snow melt drains into that area (poor design). Good things about the hotel: close to Metro station, parking garage is secure (worth the $20+tax to keep your car out of the snow/cold!). Warning: Parking garage not designed for anything bigger/taller than a compact car.

Reviews.Title: “Entirely enjoyable from A to Z”
Reviews.Author: Jack44059
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Residence Marriott Westmount (Feb 17th) was entirely enjoyable from A to Z. Ttipadvisor had informed of the ongoing renovations at that location. Therefore, I did not make an online reservation. The receptionist (telephone) was most amicable and assured us that a newly renovated room would be available. Our trip to Montreal was quicker than anticipated. Upon our early arrival at the hotel, the receptionist was very understanding. She explained that we could immediately occupy a room that was ready on the South side if we wished. She pointed out that the room that had already selected on the North side would give us a better view of Mont-Royal if we could delay our registration till 3pm. She gave us a temporary key so that we could park in the garage. We then enjoyed a stroll along Sainte-Catherine Avenue until the normal registration time. Upon our return, the new receptionist was equally agreeable. Everything in the room was immaculate. The view (17th floor) was outstanding! It was a delightful start to our day and a half escapade in Montreal. The following day started with a superb buffet breakfast (complimentary). The employees in the restaurant were also very attentive. There are many sightseeing opportunities in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. The 20-minute walk the Old Montreal is a pleasant outing by itself. There are countless interesting stops to be made along the way. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this residence.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and conveniently located in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Mason2012
Reviews.Content: It's convenietly located close to ATWATER metro station. Rooms have been renovated but not bathrooms. However because this hotel is very popular specially at weekends, damages can be noticed easily on the ceiling, paint...etc. It has around 20 floors with only 2 elevators. You cannot park your car within the hotel parking if you have an SUV. You need to park it within a 5-minute walking distance open parking that has specific regulations. Breakfast is convenient and they offer free snacks in the evening hours

Reviews.Title: “renovated vs un-renovated”
Reviews.Author: duckioo
Reviews.Content: I was given an old room when I checked in. It was horrible with a murky smell that made me gag. The furniture were old and quite outdated. Because of the condition, I asked to change room. Nothing was available until the next day and with a slight increase in the room rate, I was put in one of their newly renovated rooms. The difference was literally night and day!! The first room I would give them a 1 star as it was pretty much a 2-star hotel quality. But the newly renovated room I would give a 4 stars! Dear hotel management, I sincerely hope that you have plans to renovate all the rooms soon. It really makes a huge difference and I look forward to the day that the renovation is complete. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: 69gtojim
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with some reluctance as a lot of reviews commented that it was old and in need of renovation etc. I was pleasantly surprised when we were checked into a room that was recently renovated and found the accomodations to be great! The lobby and common areas all looked new as well. It was convienient since the Atwater Metro stop was only a block away and other parts of downtown within a few minutes walk. The breakfast was comporable to the breakfast offerings that you have to pay for at a typically Marriott Courtyard hotel, so overall I was very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mrmusic4ads
Reviews.Content: Residence Inn Montreal West Overall I had a very nice stay. Travelled with my wife and 3 kids aged 9 -13. The staff at check in was pleasant, efficient and very helpful since my French isn't good at all. We felt appreciated at all times. Looking outside the building, the hotel has obviously been around for a long time. The rooms are updated, (or in the process of) but smaller then a lot of the residence Inns I've stayed in. Overall they're clean and functional for being retrofits. I like the balcony off of the sitting area. Some of the common areas, doors, and halls appear to require some TLC. That said, they're doing reno's and updates as of my stay dated Dec 18, 2011. The pool was a bit cool, and there's no Hot tub. The change room had a dry sauna which was nice. There are balcony's surrounding the pool area, but it was well below freezing and we didn't venture out. The breakfast buffet ("continental-plus" so to speak) was one of the best and most efficiently run I've visited. Great selection of food, fresh and very clean. The staff was excellent and their was ample seating. Parking underground is nerve racking if you have a minivan as the ceilings are very low. Keep that in mind. I'd stay again, and should be even better once the reno's are completed. The breakfast was worth it alone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, reasonable”
Reviews.Author: eatatzazu
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in early December, 2011. Very friendly and courteous receptionists. Upgraded from regular room booked through AARP-Expedia to 11th floor suite on check-in. Pool and exercise room open most hours; both useful. Room very quiet and bed very comfortable. Lots of water pressure in shower. Would stay again next time I come to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “long stay”
Reviews.Author: urbantripper
Reviews.Content: Good solution for a long stay trip. Very good breakfast included. They offer you two buffet dinner a week!!! Room with kitchen too small!! Nice swimming pool and area fitness. In room there is just cable internet, wifi in the lobby. Long stay parking is very value for money: 8$/day. The hotel is in a very good position, close to downtown, in Westmount a nice area, 2 minutes walking to Atwater Metro Station.

Reviews.Title: “No worth it”
Reviews.Author: kbhatia
Reviews.Content: Was bookd to stay for 5 nights @ RI, Montreal. HAd chosen this property as our usual hotel was full and we expected a certain standard being a Mariott. As soon as we checked we regretted it. The hotel is quite run down and needs major renovation in the rooms. The front desk said they were in the process of renovations and all the renovated rooms were full. So we had the older rooms. The great thing about RI was the breakfast. Usual continental stuff + waffle maker + oatmeal. Also location wide its about a 15 min walk to downtown Golden Mile area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay if Downtown Hotels are over priced”
Reviews.Author: ugolini78
Reviews.Content: I"ll stay here for work if the downtown hotels are booked or over priced. About a 20 minute walk to Ste. Catherine/McGill College. Clean hotel. Big rooms, great staff. Usually priced right. Pool is nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sleep after alot of travel”
Reviews.Author: svm18
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop before heading home to Australia from a month of traveling for work. I must admit i was exhausted by this stage, and I was pleasantly surprised at how lux this hotel was compared to the others that i had stayed in in Europe. A rather non descript entrance, but once i was in my room, i felt i was in a little home away from home. More like a mini apartment, I had my own lvining and kitchenette space, my own bedroom, and bathroom of course. There were 2 flat screen tv's, so i felt a bit special... but the thing which i wrote home about was the bed and the pillows. Its a big call, but for me, this hotel won hands down in having the most confortable bed, and sleepable pillows i have ever come across in a hotel (and i have slept in many for lux to hostel). And thats the only thing that should count... For all the other details, breakfast you had a choice of eating in the dining area, or taking it away to your room. I wasn't so fussed on the breakfast... ceral/bread/fake eggs/waffles to junk foodish for me (there was fruit, but I'm not big on fruit). The location is good walk into the city centre maybe10mins max or you can catch the train which takes a whole 2mins, i did both and both was fine. They have on-site parking (approx C$20), which is tight, but was perfectable fine for us. The people at reception were really polite and friendly, and were also a good laugh. I would so go back to this hotel, whether it be for business or holiday... great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “My home in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: eligauthier
Reviews.Content: Since a few years, every time we go to Montreal, we settle down in the hotel Marriott, Lincoln street. The reception is exceptional. The offered apartments are spacious and very comfortable. We find there all that is necessary for a long or short stay. During our last stay, we offered us a completely renewed apartment and splendidly decorated. Really a place where life is enjoyable. The employees are courteous, thoughtful and worry about our well-being. The breakfast offered every morning is copious and varied. And, still there, they receive us with a smile. Really, difficult to find better, especially because the hotel is situated in the center of the city near stores, museums, theaters, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: SoccergodManU
Reviews.Content: The property is in a great location close to downtown, nice walking area. Traveled with two families. The pool was a hit. Room was a good size, clean. Well supplied kitchenettes. Breakfast was the regular fare, Our daughter has nut allergies and most of the food was safe for her and staff were able to provide the labels for us to read, they took are to keep foods fairly safely seperated. Staff was great. The only problem is that the rooms could use a little sprucing up as they are starting to look a little tired( paint chips, need a bit of caulking repairs, etc). Windows need to be replace. We parked around the corner at the outdoor parking with no problems. ($15) Well done.

Reviews.Title: “great location, wonderful staff, makes me want to move to Montreal”
Reviews.Author: alyce888
Reviews.Content: The staff could not be nicer or more helpful. The front desk was great with recommendations, they really knew the area. The rooms were immaculate clean. I have dust and mold allergies and never had a problem. The rooms are spacious and stylish, we had one of the recently renovated rooms. My not appeal to those of a more traditional taste, but I loved it. Having a full kitchen is always great. Having breakfast or evening snack without leaving the room. Also, I take medication that needs refrigeration There is a very nice indoor rooftop pool. The gym and sun deck was also there. The neighborhood is great! There are 2 shopping centers, grocery stores, drug stores and wonderful restaurants of every type and price point. It was like a very clean and friendly version of New York City's Upper West Side, where I used to live. There is a metro station 2 short blocks away so it is a breeze to get anywhere. We plan to stay here when we come to Montreal for the yearly conference! The only things that may be a negative is the Manager's Evening party was a bit disappointing, compared to other Residence Inns. The business center only had one computer and printer, so there was always a line. (I had my own laptop but needed to print) I had no problems with my internet speed in the room, but would have like the flexibility that wireless would provide.

Reviews.Title: “A Well-Equipped but Tired Property”
Reviews.Author: jrileymail
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fair hike from the Old City, but for a few day stay the lower cost justified a taxi or bus or long walk. In an urban residential neighborhood. A mixed review. The positives included typical Marriott thoroughness in anticipating traveler needs: good lighting, in-room coffee, lots of toiletries and towels, large laundry facility, in-hotel shop, etc. Staff was exceptionally helpful and pleasant-very well trained. Downsides were the rock-hard beds, VERY slow elevators, and overall shabby condition of the hotel. Some mildew in tub grout, threadbare and stained carpet, wimpy blankets, drab decor, etc. This place is in bad need of a facelift. However the value proposition, particularly for a suite with a kitchen, was pretty good, espcially for a family or a longer-term visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: DrunkInCubaNow
Reviews.Content: Room was a nice size with a usable kitchenette and nice living room. Bathroom was not great. Clean but dated and low water pressure. Definitely a place I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS OK.”
Reviews.Author: MarioM
Reviews.Content: Very well located at the edge of the downtown area . Nice neighborhood . Close to a mayor metro station. Building a little bit old. Professional staff. Very good free breakfast every day. Free newspapers each day. Parking is $20 extra each night and is a little bit complicated. They gave us a two bedroom suite w/ kitchenette which was great for our family of 4 adults. The kitchenette do not have stove just microwave + electric burners + refrig.+ cooking utensils

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great staff, but far from everything”
Reviews.Author: RoRosa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff was especially friendly and helpful. It's located in a nice residential area, but you have to walk several blocks to get to restaurants, shops and metro.If we had planned the trip better, that would have been ok, but it took us by surprise, especially when it rained most of the weekend, unexpectedly. Most of the cabinet doors in the kitchenette were fake!! But there is a full-size refrigerator and microwave. There was a stove, but no pans, etc. The pool is deep but small, square shaped, so not a lap swimming pool. The exercise room has a wonderful view of the city!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good value in a good location”
Reviews.Author: nottnott
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment on the 9th floor in July. 2 teenagers in the living room and my wife and I in the bedroom. From previous reviews we knew that many of the rooms had been renovated, and it seemed like ours was. Very clean, nice bedding, updated but small bathroom. The kitchen was fine and fully equipped. The one bedroom suite was crowded for the 4 of us, as we knew it would be, but we didn't spend much time there, and there is only one 2 bedroom unit on each floor, and it was about an extra 100.00 US$ a nite. There is an indoor pool on the roof, with places outside to enjoy the view(21st floor) and you can pull chairs outside if you want, though it is not meant for that. No whirlpool but there are saunas. The location is excellent- short walk to many restaurants, shopping, metro, st catherine st, grocery store, etc. Too far to walk to and from Old Montreal- you could maybe walk one way and take the Metro back. We drove most places in town- you do have to pay for parking at the hotel. We couldn't park in the hotel garage because our van was too tall, but there was a place right up the street where it cost us 60.00 for the 5 days with in and out priveledges. Very easy and convenient, not a problem. I'm sure there are nicer places to stay in Montreal, and being in Old town would be great, but you couldn't get this kind of space, and it would be much more expensive. This is an older hotel, and I could find minor things to complain about ( slow elevator) but I would be nitpicking. We typically stay in 3 star, sometimes 4 star hotels and I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Practical & Good Value-Watch out Pet Fee”
Reviews.Author: Skierz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family-very clean and great rooftop pool for kids with views of city. Free breakfast is excellent. Hotel accepts pets which is a plus, but rather than just taking a deposit and refunding it as long as there is no damage, they charge you $75 up front to keep a pet in your room-no refund. This was a little misleading, but since we were there with our pet already, we didn't have a choice and had to pay the fee.

Reviews.Title: “would the last place to stay in montreal”
Reviews.Author: Mathew14
Reviews.Content: Hi guys i am here in Montreal for three weeks , somehow i booked this hotel , but it was so disgusting that i checked out in three days , only thing is good at this place is their breakfast ! rest is your luck , any other roadside motel are far better in hospitality then this people , their behaviours , their presentation , their manager yes their General manager (Lady) hey will give u a felling that its u r requirement to stay at our place else we dont need any customer !!:), if u want to stay close to Montreal down town , i would recommend please chose some other location , but not this one ,

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Renovations!”
Reviews.Author: smileyboo22
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this Hotel was Fantastic! The room was newly renovated and totally modernized! We loved the new furniture and granite counter tops in both the kitchen and bathroom! This place was truly a home away from home. The staff was very sweet and helpful! The hotel was very clean and the landscaping was very pleasing to look at! It is very close to shopping, restaurants movie theatre and the metro! We absolutely loved it! We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great room”
Reviews.Author: wondering_11
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old daughter and 13 year old nephew and I spend a great weekend here. I was hesitant based on the reviews, but our room and stay was fantastic. 19th floor, great renovations, a suite, a balcony with fresh air. Could not have been better. The kitchen was all granite with a brand new convection oven. We liked the location because it was not in a touristy area. 20 minute train ride to the old port was really easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay outside of Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ladyofshalott306
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Canada weekend in July 2010. We booked late, so there were not many hotels avaliable at a decent price in Montreal, so we went with the Residence Inn. The hotel itself was getting older, but the rooms were kept clean, which was great! There was a kitchenette in the room, which was nice. There was also a balcony off the room, which gave us a beautiful view of the city. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful, serving both hot and cold food. It was quite busy there, so I recommend going early to get a spot and enjoy the variety of food. This hotel was close to public transit, which made it easy to get around to the different areas of the city. I would stay here again if I came to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the Grand prix weekend!”
Reviews.Author: leechie1231
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our five night stay at the Residence Inn Westmount, and could not have been happier. The front desk staff was extremely friendly, and helpful! They even called our room to check and see if we needed any extra towels, pillows or blankets. The included breakfast was a huge plus and got us started off right for the day at the track. There were many options for breakfast (both hot and cold) that changed each day, we were never at a loss for something to eat. Options included, scrambled eggs, pancakes, franch toast, waffles, bacon, sausage, hash browns, oatmeal, cereal, toast, bagels, fruit and yogurt to name a few. The room was completely suitable for our needs and clean. Having the kitchen was a huge plus as it enabled us to cook dinner in the room after a long day at the track. There is an IGA at the Atwater metro station two blocks away, along with a variety of other shops, restauarants and a movie theater. Interesting note, if you wish the hotel will go food shopping for you during the day as long as you leave a list at the front desk by 9AM. The pool upstairs on the penthouse level is nice for a refreshing dip after a long day, but is not large. There is also a gym and the ice machine on the PH level as well. Laundry facilities are located on the sub lobby levels along with garage access. We would most definitely stay there again on a non-GP weekend so we can get more of a feel for Montreal, and do more sightseeing. Overall a very positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice Before Booking Here”
Reviews.Author: 1_DFW_Bob
Reviews.Content: We did not make advance reservations, but we certainly were not expecting this property to be this bad. The first thing you notice is the property is located on a one-way street. So unloading must be done from the passenger side of vehicle. Signs are prominently posted stated 15 minute maximum to unload. We were driving our SUV (Mercury Mountaineer) and had sufficient luggage for the two week road trip we were on. Also, we had our pet Chihuahua with us and needed a "pet friendly" hotel which this hotel is. The check in experience was pleasant and acceptable. We were told that their on site parking would not accommodate our SUV due to the height of the vehicle, but they had a deal with some school worked up. We were told it was very safe and secure and just around the corner. It turns out it was 3 blocks away and was simply a public parking lot which requires exact payment in advance, no change made and no credit cards. The bellman cart for the luggage was typical of the carts you find at many hotels. What wasn't typical was the fact that with the cart in the elevator, there was no room for anyone else to enter the elevator. I proceeded to our sixth floor room (#610), a corner "suite" and my wife came up on the next cycle of elevators. I had wanted a king room but only double beds were available. At least it was non-smoking. While the linens on the bed appeared to be clean, the rest of "suite" was far from clean. The carpet was extremely worn, with traffic trails, what appeared to be cigarette burns and did not look the least bit clean. The lamp shade was badly stained, which to me indicated that the room was not always, "non-smoking". The shower had what appeared to be mold in the corners of the walls where they met at the tub. The A/C unit leaked badly onto the carpeting under the unit. The couch in the studio was tattered and torn and appeared as if it was just picked up at Goodwill. It took pictures of all these shortcomings but don't believe it would be appropriate for me to post them now as this is still an ongoing situation with the hotel. About 10:30pm a terrible noise that sounded like a jack hammer was off and on for about 20 minutes. I have no earthly idea what it was. Earlier at one point, the smell of garlic cooking was so strong in our room it also brought tears to your eyes. Upon checking out the next morning, my wife and I mentioned all the above to the front desk clerk. She was obviously not empowered to do anything. We had made the statement that the $75.00 fee they collect for each pet, should maybe be spend on cleaning the rooms. I don't think she understood the implication of the remark. I wasn't expecting so sort of concession, but nothing other than to comment she would mention it to her manager. Two days later I received a call from a woman who apparently was the manager. She also completely missed the mark and whole conversation but offered to refund 1/2 of the pet fee. I later noticed in checking my on line card account that in fact a refund had posted. At same time I also noticed that another $60+ dollars was added to the bill. There is no reason for that charge as we did not charge anything to the room, etc. I still have that battle to fight. Bottom line is customer satisfaction is all about expectations. If they are met, you are satisfied, if not then, you are dissatisfied. If you plan on staying here, don't set your expectations very high.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Too Long”
Reviews.Author: USCMann
Reviews.Content: Visited Montreal for one evening and stayed at the Residence Inn Westmount. The rooms are dated, the breakfast was average, and the beds were very uncomfortable. Also, unlike other Residence Inn's, there is not a manager's reception with free beer and wine. I would advise to seek another place to stay when visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but old and tired”
Reviews.Author: NortheastBusLeisure
Reviews.Content: Even for a business hotel, this placed lacked character. Rooms definitely need renovation--the tile on the bathroom was showing its age. The sink in the bathroom was clogged and wouldn't drain--an obvious fix that I'm surprised was allowed to occur before any guest checked in. Most likely wouldn't stay here again unless I got priced out of competing business hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Montreal 05/2011”
Reviews.Author: blueskies15-10
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the centre, shopping street St. Catherine is in walking distance, was in 17th floor, rooms arespaceous, were recently remodeled, no minibar, free internet, aircondition difficult to regulate, deluxe room had balcony and kitchen, frtee newspaper, breakfast is included for 185 CA$, on the weekend noisy because of tourists, breakfast is very basic, for a few days ok

Reviews.Title: “I fell in love with the renovations”
Reviews.Author: danikaandalok
Reviews.Content: We attended a family friends bhamitzvah and booked the Residence Inn because of the location, and boy was I surprised and impressed by the friendly staff and amazing rooms. Upon check-in they advised us that the rooms had recently been renovated, which usually means a new bed spread and some art....but not the case here!! When we entered our rooms they had a very fresh odor and the renovations from top to bottom were amazing. They had a very contemporary feel with gorgeous granite kitchens and sleek furniture. This might sound cliche, but I didn't want to leave! I can't wait to head back to Montreal so I can grab a Shwartz sandwich and stay at my new favorite hotel. Keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, nice room, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Bookish12866
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Montreal without a hotel reservation on President's Day Weekend, and stumbled across this Residence Inn by chance. I was nicely surprised by the rate, the staff were super friendly and helpful, and the room was a great size. If I had any complaints, they would be about the lack of parking, which is not really unexpected in an urban hotel - there is an underground parking structure, for very short vehicles, but surface parking is available about a block away at the Montreal Seminary.Though the room was nice, the whole place could have been a bit cleaner. It had a slightly run-down quality (spots on the carpet in and out of the room, old appliances in the kitchenettes, a computer keyboard with most of the letters rubber off) that wasn't terrible, but was certainly noticeable. The Westmount neighborhood is a great place to stay in Montreal. I spent a good deal of my time at the AMC movie theater that's in the old hockey stadium. There are loads of restaurants, grocery stores, and funky little shops on St.Catherine's street. All in all, it was a nice weekend getaway, made nicer by the friendly people at the Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Needs to have a facelift”
Reviews.Author: tzvitas
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very nice. Our stay here was ok, I booked a room for 4 adults, only to be told there are no roll-away beds or cots. The rooms and bathroom are a bit shabby...

Reviews.Title: “mediocre stay”
Reviews.Author: Zainny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a few days over December and while there are good and bad things to say about it, overall the experience was a bad one and I would not stay there again or recommend this hotel to others. For me, the two worst aspects of the stay were: - This is the worst bed I have ever slept in. It was very hard, and every morning I woke up with shoulder and back pains. - The room was cold (over winter), and the wall heater in the bedroom was both ineffective and loud. I resorted to using several extra blankets. For what was supposed to be a relaxing getaway, I didn't get much sleep... Some other minor niggles include the elevators being very slow, breakfast being low quality (scrambled eggs tasted like cardboard), the cutlery in the room being dirty/not washed properly...and why the heck can't they upgrade their TV's to LCDs already? The good: - Location is fantastic. - Staff were very friendly and helpful. - A nice surprise to find a fully equipped kitchen + appliances. As I said, a mixed bag but the negatives very much outweighed the positives for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff but need a good update”
Reviews.Author: bimmerSP
Reviews.Content: Nice location and easy to walk to near by attraction. Staff was nice at the check in and pool and common area are nice but the room are old and not clean like you would expect a Marriott to be. They need to up the maintenance in the room and they need to update TV (still very old TV, not LCD like most other Marriott). I will pass on all the details of the room, but this is Marriott and Im use to a much much higher standard. I would recommend it for the location and the staff. However if you plan to enjoy a beautiful room, you might be very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely service and common areas let down by seriously outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: mmppwwzz
Reviews.Content: There are many good things about this hotel: - It's well located close to restaurants, coffee shops, museums and a metro station - It has a great common areas including free wireless in the lobby lounge and the restaurant appears clean, up to date and well maintained. There are complimentary desktop workstations which can be used to print out a boarding pass etc. - There is also an excellent pool on the top floor with a wonderful view over Montreal. This really is the best, and probably least utilized, part of the hotel. There are separate male and female change rooms with a sauna which is extremely welcome after experiencing a cold November day in Montreal. - The staff are also very friendly and helpful. All very good, so it's a mystery how the hotel could possibly have let the rooms remain with very outdated decor and furniture. It's a real step back in time kind of like visiting your grandmother's house which has not changed for decades. Very old powder pink fixtures in the bathroom, chintzy curtains, worn out queen size mattresses, giant chunky 1980's TV's, and hilarious furniture that you see at flea markets and wonder who would possibly buy that stuff. Management must know hat there is a huge difference between the decor of this Residence Inn and almost every other one in the chain. Could a refurb be on the cards? If not, then I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable and convenient, with all of the necessary amenities.”
Reviews.Author: JerryB11
Reviews.Content: Located in a nice residential area of Westmount. This hotel has full kitchen facilities with range, fridge, toaster and dishwasher. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly, professional and helpful. Complimentary breakfast was delicious and served in a bright pleasant dining room. There is clean secure underground self parking with easy access to elevators. It provides easy access to downtown, St. Catherine's St., the Pepsi Forum, The Bell Centre, and all of the main shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: rmcb825
Reviews.Content: Good points: Nice location, nice size of room, breakfast with good selection included and great front desk service. Bad points: Dirty carpets in the hall, hotel really showing it's age - needs painting and new carpets, only two elevators - long wait times, dripping tap in the bath tub, water is cold in the swimming pool, loud noise when the heat came on.

Reviews.Title: “awesome family choice for central montreal”
Reviews.Author: familyguypaul
Reviews.Content: this is the only way to go if you plan on visiting montreal with young children and don't want to spend a fortune. our 2 bedroom suite, (nothing like a vegas suite) had a full sized fridge, microwave, stove/oven, eat-in kitchen, living room with tv, and 2 small queen bedrooms with TVs. nothing fancy. I am a marriott platinum elite and never stay in residence inns when traveling for work, but with family, this can't be beat. my wife and i got a separate bedroom from our 3 kids. 2 shared a queen bed and the youngest in a pack and play.breakfast, which normally tops 50$ for a family of 5, was free. the rooftop pool was a perfect daily treat for the kids. and the sauna was a treat for me. nice views from our room of mt royal and of the whole city from the rooftop pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and tired”
Reviews.Author: sandr20
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in Westmount which limited our hotel options. But, the Residence Inn had decent if not stellar reviews so we booked and several friends followed our lead. The lobby has been updated but the same cannot be said for the rooms which are grim and dirty. Carpets are thoroughly stained. Walls are cracked. Furniture is tired and lighting is limited. Bathroom grouting was mouldy. Although much of this can be chalked up to the age of the rooms, even current cleaning is not adequate. There were hairs and dental floss on the bathroom floor. Free breakfast and a convenient location do not begin to justify the cost of this hotel. We checked out after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel overlooking the old Montreal Fourm”
Reviews.Author: nighttraveller23
Reviews.Content: hotel was clean. The staff was friendly. Easy location to find and surprisingly good weather for Montreal in March. Was able to go sightseeing without a winter coat :) I only wish they could cut down on the MSG they use in the all you can eat breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Small but Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CubanitaTravelDiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a terrific location. It's near the Forum Pepsi, and 3 short blocks from the Metro. It took less than 30 minutes to get to the location via bus/metro, and is approximately 20 minutes by Metro from Vieux Montreal. The staff was very nice and helpful. Rooms are small but comfortable, and include a full ktchen. Carpeting on the hotel floors needs to be updated. Overall, this was a good place to stay while visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great prices, great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Voyagista
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious. The breakfast was one of the best I have had included in the price of a hotel. They were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “An apartment hotel with The Mariott touch - A winning combo”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Riyadh
Reviews.Content: We had a nine day stay at this apartment hotel and we're glad we chose The Residence Inn. No shortcomings, no unpleasant surprises. I was already familiar with the area and knew that a five minute walk would get me anywhere I needed to go, including the subway station (Atwater station). The gym is available around the clock. Excellent equipment. Bring your earphones if you like to listen to CNN or TSN while using the treadmills or similar equipment. The complimentary breakfast buffet was a very pleasant surprise. More than just toasts and coffee; a full selection of juices, cereals, eggs, breakfast meats, pancakes, etc. You can even bake your own waffles. Rooms were cleaned daily and always supplied with extra towels and toiletries. The best, however, was that employees are first "Marriott Employees". They know their business and understand the industry. They anticipate your needs and offer advice before it's needed. For me, it's a no-brainer. I know where I'll stay next time I travel to Montreal. +

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: eligauthier
Reviews.Content: Corteous service. The reception is exceptional. The employees are attentives at our needs, always smiling and they are for the greater part multilingual (I am french speaker). Apartments are comfortable, cosy...Cooking facilities. We feel at home in the city center of Montreal near the subway, stores,etc. Newspaper at the door of the room every morning. Breakfast served early in the morning is delicious. Hotel to be recommanded without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms in decent location but lacking something...”
Reviews.Author: sm105
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for Westmount and McGill areas, and a short drive or public transit ride to most of the other city attractions. Rooms are very generously sized for the location and this is a huge plus when traveling in a large group. Nice balconies with excellent views as well. The drawbacks were housekeeping hammering on the door multiple times every morning for absolutely inconsequential reasons (do we really need to be woken up at 730am to be advised that our newspaper has arrived???) and pretending not to understand when we ask politely not to. The springs on the sofabeds also were awful and gave one of us a stiff back. The TVs were hard to understand and kept coming on in the middle of the night playing previews for PPV movies. Despite all this, the front desk staff were simply awesome and full of suggestions/maps/ideas of what to do in Montreal. For the excellent weekend rates we got, it was a gem of a deal for Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Dear God - Simply Aweful”
Reviews.Author: Thompson416
Reviews.Content: This place is desperately in need of a makeover. The self service breakfast (complimentary) was O.K. although limited and no subsitute for room service. There's no mini-bar either so you're stuck going outside for food or drinks. There is a decent food court in the mall at St-Catherines. Do not bother with Nicels restuarant. Dirty and poor food. Hotel rooms are generous size but bed linenes are scratchy and cheap, towels are rough and the decor and furnishings are dated and threadbear to say the least. Seems like mostly families and retirees. If' you're travelling for business, this is no substitute for home.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: cbft
Reviews.Content: The staff people are just Super Great. Always there when you need them but know how to make themselves discreet when they attend your every needs. Great location - walking distance from great restaurants, shopping malls and nightclubs! and the Atwater metro station. Fantastic view on the PH Level (21st floor) from the indoor swimming pool balcony. Great place to stay for anyone visiting Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced, Well Located, Clean and Convenient for Families”
Reviews.Author: Torontotraveller39
Reviews.Content: While this hotel certainly isn't luxurious and the carpets and furnishings look a bit threadbare in places, we thought it was a great place to stay with two small kids. We got a two bedroom suite with kitchenette and enjoyed cooking our evening meals. The place was very clean, the beds were comfortable and the service was very responsive. There was a problem with one of the lights in the kids' room but we called reception and someone came to fix it right away. The location is also convenient to shopping on Sherbrooke or St. Catherine. The small pool on the penthouse level was a hit with the kids. The breakfast buffet is also quite decent and had a good selection of kid-friendly foods. All in all we thought this was good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “10 year Platinum member VERY disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KMGTexas2
Reviews.Content: I travel about 200 nights per year and try to concentrate at Marriott because they are consistently good. This hotel is the first exception in several years. The key issue is that housekeeping repeatedly ignores the "Privacy" placard on the door and rifled through my room. I complained to the general manager Kathryn [--], no action was taken and housekeeping continued to violate my privacy. Management seems not to have control of labor at this hotel. In it's favor, the location is excellent and the front desk personnel are mostly excellent. The other negative is the condition of the property. Malfunctions include the microwave, stove top burner, knob on the oven, shower head. The mattress on the bed is rudimentary and uncomfortable. Just a plain lack of attention to the physical property. I have to do a project here in Montreal that will keep me here 75% of the time through spring of '11. But I will find another Marriott to call home.

Reviews.Title: “Worn and Phone Service Charge”
Reviews.Author: D_Train_Traveler
Reviews.Content: After staying two nights at the Halifax Marriott Residence Inn. I decided to change my hotel plans for my Montreal Stopover by canceling my overnight stay at the Best Western Europa and booking at night at the Montreal Marriott Residence Inn (Westmount) Location. I decided to book an overnight there on my way home because I enjoyed my stay at the Residence Inn in Halifax. Check Inn was easy and quick but during the check inn process, I was informed that it costs $1.00 every time a call is made even if its a local or 1-800 number call. I found this very disturbing because im already paying money to occupy the room and if I had to make several local calls, it would of been very costly. This is the first time I have encountered this at a longer stay hotel. My train from Halifax arrived into Montreal at 9:00am and I checked in at 9:30. After and overnight train journey I was very happy to be able to access my room right away. Breakfast was still available and was able to have somthing to eat after I had checked in. After Breakfast I went to my room only to find that the room was very small compared to the room I stayed in at the Halifax location. The room had a small kitchenette which included a fridge, microwave, dishwasher, a stove and cutlery however with the size of the room there was only a desk with only one chair. How could a couple take advantage of the kitchenette if there isn't anywhere to eat????? I was also not impressed with the furniture as it looked like it was from the 80's and the room looked dated and worn. To make things wrose, dirty dishes were left in the hallway. I also found the air conditioner to be very noisey which made it hard to sleep at night. The rooms in this hotel need to be upgraded. Very disapointing for a Marriott!!! On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and I was able to enjoy a nice breakfast upon my arrival and the next morning. The breakfast was plentifull and offered a good variety including, juice, fresh self prepared waffles, scrambled eggs, bacon, cerial, bagles, fruit and toast. I was happy with the breakfast but I was very disapointed with the eggs as they tasted very stale. Coffee and Newspapers were available through out the day. This hotel is located in a quiet residential neibgrourhood close to the Atwater Metro Station. Noise and Street People begging for money were not a problem and I felt very safe at this location. However to get to the Shopping District or Downtwon expect a long walk or a $10 dollar cab ride. For me, it was a 30 minute walk to the Central Train Station. If your comming to Montreal to enjoy the night life or to do some shopping, I would stay at a more central location. Really this hotel is just a place to sleep if you had to spend the night in Montreal if you were on business or traveling through. No frills and nothing special. Next time I visit montreal, I will stay at another Marriott location or hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Mikemarinoo
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal - steps away from the Atwater stop. The staff is friendly, and helpful more than at some five star hotels. The room were clean ( though they should get the same makeover as the hip lobby) but a bit out dated. The pool was a welcome respite from the heatwave 90plus for four days in a row! Breakfast was standard and useful since we had a seven year old with us. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL STAFF I'VE EVER ENCOUNTERED!”
Reviews.Author: TXTurners
Reviews.Content: With this being our first trip to Montreal, and my first trip out of the U.S. I did my research before choosing this hotel. With a government rate of $129 per night, we definitely got our money's worth. First of all, the staff is top notch. True professionals. Edison, Brenda, Richard and Kathryn were always ready and willing to provide their expertise for restaurants, attractions, etc. I mean we would literally ask a question and they would pull up the information on the web instantly. In fact, one night I asked for some additional salt and pepper packets at the front desk and Richard took the time and effort to find some in the kitchen and provided me with a cup of salt and pepper. Totally above and beyond what I expected. I don't know where the manager of this hotel found their staff but I hope he/she is doing everything to keep these great staff members. These individuals are part of the reason our stay in Montreal was so wonderful and why we will be back. Now, the hotel is definitely not 5 star (we visit Chicago frequently and stay at the Hilton always); however, the rate was great considering most hotels cost almost $200 per night in Montreal and the neighborhood was ideal...not too far from the action of St. Catherine but quiet enough to enjoy hanging out on your balcony. This area is also very safe. Anytime my husband and I see single females walking their puppies at 2am we pretty much know that we picked a safe spot to reside temporarily. You also have to use your card to get into the hotel after midnight which is another level of security that we liked. The metro is less than 5 minutes away which was perfect for our 10 day stay considering we did not rent a car (which I suggest since the Metro is simple to manuveur just make sure you buy an unlimited pass). Also, the hotel is conveniently located to restaurants (Angelina Guidos is yummy), a shopping center with a pharmacy and grocery store inside (and all within walking distance). However, there was one problem when we first arrived. After pulling back the sheets, I noticed a yellow marker stain on the sheets but when I reported it to the front desk, Edison offered me to upgrade or change sheets. Being that we'd been up for 13 hrs. I chose the upgrade. My husband and I were so glad that we did considering the suite was much roomier and the 17th floor provided an awesome view. Oh yeah, and there was no change in the room rate. The kitchenettes in the suite are ideal. My husband and I being picky breakfast eaters were not feeling the breakfast options offered by the hotel (with the exception of the potatoes and eggs which were tasty) and chose instead to buy our own meats to cook and just brought the fixings up to our room to eat when we were ready. This worked out well for us a few nights when we wanted to eat in as well. Go to Atwater Market and pick up some fresh fixings and enjoy a romantic night in like we did! Ultimately, this is the best hotel that I have stayed in in terms of the level of service, way better than any service I've expererienced in some pretty nice hotels in CA, Hawaii, or even Puerto Rico. My husband, having travelled across the world while in the Navy for 21 years agreed with me...he's never had service like he did at Residence Inn Westmount. Look past the older furnishings but rest assure that the room is going to be clean (thanks Maurene) and choose Residence Inn Westmount as the place to stay when visiting the fabulous city of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good night sleep, parking and wireless are a challenge”
Reviews.Author: ggtirevite
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good (not best) location, about 10 streets from Crescent street and the rest of the action. The room was not bad. We had a two double beds in one room and a pullout in the other, two TVs. The bathroom was just ok, some paint peeled. It was obvious that it had not been updated in a quite a few years. It was difficult to get a good night sleep, caused by two issues: First was the mattresses on the double beds creaked loudly when anyone moves on the beds. They should be replaced. Second, (and somewhat out of the control of the hotel), we had a family with small children across the hall, and the parents left them get in in and out of their hotel room and play in the hall from 6h30 AM on. Second issue is that the wireless access only worked about 30% of the time. When I called the front desk (did it three times over the course of the stay), it waited a minimum of 5 minutes and the record was 17, after being told to hold for 'a moment' . With teenagers, that was a big issue. Third, forget the underground garage if you have a minivan (not bog enough to accommodate larger cars), their option is an outside garage two+ blocks away, which was much less convenient than anticipated. At least, it was cheap ($9 a day). I am a regular in the Marriott chain and usually stay at the residence inn downtown (on Peel street) where I have never had a bad stay. I have also stayed at other residence inns elsewhere, and was always satisfied. My recommendation would be to stay downtown if it is available. Better location, and staff always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: SteaminPete
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a congested area of apartment buidlings just above the downtown. The room was good and had stove,refr.,micro. and sink. The staff was very helpful and polite, the elevators are very slow,and the parking garage under the building is sized for compact cars. Staying here was very central to getting around the city to see the sites. To be honest I would look outside of the city for room if we came back.

Reviews.Title: “Not in the Mainstream, but a good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: hhiguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel, while attending the Rotary International convention. The hotel is situated in a nice quiet residential neighborhood, but near restaurants and shops. It is a block and a half from the "metro" Atwater station, so getting around the city is quite easy. The rooms are very nice, with a large and comfortable sleeping area, and a small office. they have wired free internet, and serve a full breakfast each day. some nights they offer a managers happy hour, but no adult beverages are available. I would very happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel with great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: smileyboo22
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a Prime location. Within walking distance of Rue St. Catherine, which is where all the shopping and restaurants are. The Hotel is well maintained, and the 1 bedroom suites are like mini apartments. We love the views from the Hotel! They also have a fantastic indoor pool, sauna and exercise room. They serve delicious breakfasts and evening snacks and refreshments. The staff is very courteous and helpful. Will definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay I have had in 25 years”
Reviews.Author: omeer
Reviews.Content: If I had to move to Montreal I would select this hotel until I would find a permenant home, as it feels like my home. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Loved the penthouse pool”
Reviews.Author: BoldlyGO
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in Montreal on my own for six days and wanted somewhere near to Concordia University. This fitted the bill well. It was actually very convenient for downtown as well as the University, as Atwater station is just around the corner. The Metro is very easy to use, and that line also takes you out to the Olympic park and its sites easily. A short trip also to Old Montreal. The studio suite I had was spacious with a very well equipped kitchen. I am not sure where the moans on this site about the rooms come from. Yes it is an older hotel, but although the corridors are well used, it is clean and the foyer is very modern. The room had a good desk corner with internet and a good sized bathroom and there was also a balcony. I realised afterwards that if you want a view ask for a Mount Royal view room. I had a downtown view. From the Penthouse where the pool is you can see both ways very well. The pool is lovely- small but well looked after. Refreshing after a hot walk! Overall, I think this would be a really good hotel if you had a family as the rooms are spacious and well kept. The desk staff are very helpful and welcoming and can give advice on places to go. They were a bit funny about my credit card booking via Co op travel in England as they said the card didnt work- I explained how big a company the Co op were and that there must be a mistake, but it took almost my whole stay to sort which was not good. It turned out to be a mistyping I think! They were very friendly about it, but the continued saga was wearing. Breakfast is good and there is lots of choice. If I had to moan it would be that there is often a variation in whether the cutlery is plastic or metal. So one morning we had lots of metal knives but only plastic forks! The coffee was great. The service varied from good to less cheerful! The gym is small but enough and well kept. I would recommend this as somewhere to stay in Montreal. There is a good local shopping centre around the corner where you can buy all that you need if you want to cook.

Reviews.Title: “A big thank you”
Reviews.Author: DogendEssex
Reviews.Content: A big thanks to Kathy and her staff for all their help and service throughout our stay in Montreal. Suggest Guidos on Catherines for some exellent pasta and a great night out when the hockey is on. Also Val's resturant in the old town.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - A Favourite of ours”
Reviews.Author: julesvernecanada
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice now, with our family. 2 young kids 7 and 11. The room we get is sometimes called a BedRoom Suite. It has 2 rooms, with a kitchenette and a balcony. One room has the Queen bed, and the pull-out out sofa bed is in the other room that has the kitchenette. Included in the price is a great buffet breakfast, and wired internet in the room. When the sofa-bed is pulled out, you cannot walk around it to get to the balcony, it opens right up against the TV cabinet. (there is a TV in each room). The matress on the sofa-bed is pretty thin, and is okay for kids, but I wouldn't want to sleep on it. The buffet breakfast is great: scrambled egs, sausage (or bacon depending on the morning), toast your own bagel, or toast or english muffin, muffins, donuts, cereal (cold and porridge), yogurt, fruit salad, make your own waffle, juice, milk, coffee.. and the staff keep refilling things till breakfast is done. This is NOT just a continental breakfast!..sometimes the china plates run out and they use styrofoam (I hate cutting on those) The internet, is a wired connection, and works great on the desk near the sofabed. The kitchenette has a fullsize fridge, a stove, a microwave (orville popcorn included) and sink and a diskwasher. some pots and plates and stainless cutlery included. Pool is up on the top floor (23?) and is small, and a bit cool, but good for a dip at the end of the day (open till 10:30pm).. the gym on the same level has about 5 machines and is open 24 hours. The location is close enough to downtown to walk..we did it one night down to St Catherine, and it was fine. The parking garage cannot take vehicle over 5'8" (or so) so our van had to be parked in a lot 2 blocks away, $9.00 cash in an envelope for 24 hours, in and out privileges, no attendant, but patrolled by security. ON the whole, I love this place. Very convenient, and there are good deals when you pay up front!.. ..enjoy, but leave me a spot...

Reviews.Title: “My 8 guests found this hotel great.... it's in the center of all the activity!”
Reviews.Author: traveling_duckling
Reviews.Content: I am beginning to consider this my home in downtown Montreal. It was my second visit to Residence Inn Westmount with a group of students (in Montreal for training purposes). Again the staff was outstanding, they remembered my name and preferences......... which was awesome. My 8 guests found this hotel great........they really felt that it's in the center of all the activity, a few steps from shopping, great restaurants and entertainment. THANK YOU FOR ANOTHER GREAT STAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Montreal - clean, great service, lots of fun for the whole family!!”
Reviews.Author: travelexpertOttawa
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a weekend stay at the Residence Inn Montreal Westmount. This hotel is amazing - from the moment we walked in until we left, the service was excellent, the breakfast was great, the views of this amazing city were breathtaking. The pool located at the top (penthouse) was clean and never crowded and also provided an amazing panoramic view of Montreal. The suite was clean and spacious and, the full kitchen is so functional and practical. We visit Montreal often and have stayed in many hotels, this was by far our favorite hotel for so many reasons. By far, the best value - great location - you're just a few blocks from everything Montreal has to offer but, far enough so that it is quiet and peaceful at night time. We'll definitely be back - what a gem of a hotel, so glad we found it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Monctonbeachbum
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Montreal so I wanted to stay somewhere that would be easy to navigate from. The hotel was right off St. Catherine St. walking distance to some wonderful restaurants, shopping and the metro. We were recommended some fabulous restaurants by the staff such as O Noir and a great Thai one on Guy St. (I think!). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful the entire stay. The room we had was perfect, it had 2 double beds in one room and a pull out couch in the living room so it fit everyone comfortably. The full kitchenette was a bonus because we could bring leftovers with us and have whatever we needed on hand. The pool and sauna were nice and the breakfast that was included was perfect, it had something for everyone with very reasonable hours. When I go back to Montreal I will definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant time”
Reviews.Author: BaltoBee
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was extremely helpful and always greeted us. The wireless internet in the room worked perfectly and the pool and exercise area was nice. My favorite was the very adequate breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for families”
Reviews.Author: Abol4
Reviews.Content: Having a separate bedroom and a small kitchen off the main room is great when travelling with kids - you don't have to eat out if too tired/run out of money! Great location near the subway station and not far to shops and plenty of restaurants. The pool was nice too, on the top floor but also with an outside terrace. Could do with more lifts - for quite a big hotel there were only two and they took ages to get anywhere! Breakfast on weekends was a bit of a nightmare - too many people, plastic cutlery and plates and things kept running out like coffee, although it was replaced fairly quickly. Easier mid-week, but still fairly basic. However,we got a great deal on this hotel via hotels.com so it was well worth it! Even with some small niggles, still a good hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location and top notch staff”
Reviews.Author: TorontoJakela
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family and friends on a number of occasions while visiting Montreal always great value and convenient location. Close to everything downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: kutzi55
Reviews.Content: We spent our Christmas holidays at this hotel. The comfort and the excellent service made us feel right at home. The staff at the reception were always friendly and helpful, no matter what time of day it was. And just a five minute walk to the nearest subway station, great shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travellingskater
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel twice a year when in Montreal on business and have for the past 4 years. The front desk service is always excellent and the rooms are spotless and decorated with great taste. Some evenings, there are complimentary snacks in the lounge area which is lovely after a long day. The complimentary breakfast features a wide range of choices complete with coffee to go and your choice of newspaper. The hotel is quiet at night - very important after long working days. It is well situated in Westmount near a large shopping mall, theatres and great bus routes and metro service to downtown. This well priced hotel is more like having an apartment away from home as your room has complete cooking facilities which is wonderful for the traveller on extended stays or for those who do not like to dine out alone and prefer to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rama2209
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to Atwater Metro station and is nicely located very close to Montreal Downtown. This is a pure business hotel with decent breakfast and good rooms to stay. The building is very old. However the rooms are well maintained and there is a pool and GYM at the top floor of the building. There are no restaurants inside the hotel but a 5 minute walk from the hotel gives u lots of options to eat out. A very nice and good Value for Money hotel for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn Montreal Westmount: Good location! friendly, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: tnptraveler
Reviews.Content: This is not your standard Residence Inn like ones in the U.S. A friend recommended this Inn based on its location. I had my doubts since I didn't have good experience at Residence Inns in the US on two previous stays. I was pleasantly surprised by this Residence Inn for its cleaniness, good location, and friendly staff. What I liked: + Full breakfree + Helpful, friendly bilingual staff + Good location - close to downtown Montreal business district What I disliked: - parking

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff. Good breakfast and good location.”
Reviews.Author: seat-1J
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Hotel lobby was very clean and inviting. We stayed here because we needed the separate bedroom and kitchenette for a family (parents and toddler). Hotel offered a crib free of charge, but we had our own. Our rate included free breakfast in the lobby restaurant which was very good. Offered was eggs, waffles, pancake, bacon, sausage, variety of breads and bagels, cereals, fruit, yogurts, coffee, tea and juices. Nice location on a quiet residential street near Dawson College. Two blocks away is Atwater Metro station. If you have a car, there is a nice outdoor lot two blocks from the hotel on Rue Sherbrooke. The rate is 7$ CAD per day. You pay by leaving exact change in an envelope in a mail slot. Lot is very safe and spaces are always available. No attendant, come and go as you please. Also two blocks away is Rue Sainte-Catherine. There you will find all sorts of restaurants; easily walk-able. Also, where Atwater Metro station is, there is a shopping mall that offers retail stores, a supermarket, and even a discount store similar to a Wal-Mart.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a nice area of the city”
Reviews.Author: JerryB11
Reviews.Content: Located in a nice quiet residential neighborhood on the west end of Downtown. Withing Walking distance of the Atwater Metro. Clean, nice spacious rooms with kitchen. and a complimentary breakfast buffet. Underground parking, and a nice friendly bilingual staff.

Reviews.Title: “Well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: slarnold
Reviews.Content: I'm staying here for a long period, for business travel. The rooms are large, reasonably well fit out, and with a simple kitchen, and balcony. The staff are helpful, there is a good breakfast included, and the rooms are clean. There's a basic gym and pool on the top floor.. with a nice view of the mountain. An extra lift would be appreciated... 2 lifts for 20 floors leaves you waiting quite often.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, hard beds.”
Reviews.Author: StageCaptainC
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind sleeping on a brick, the place is nice. Another drawback is no hot tub, (which you will need by the end of the long walks you will be taking). Good breakfast with a lot of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par at all”
Reviews.Author: iraevski
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend at this hotel. I usually check reviews for any hotel that I am planning to stay at and this was no exception. This hotel has very decent reviews here and other places. I was very disappointed however and I am not a picky traveler, just want to get my moneyâ€™s worth. I was surprised at how small and uncomfortable the rooms were and how old/dated the rooms/things in the room were. It was nice to have a kitchen but everything was old. The bed was small and uncomfortable, the sheets old and torn in some places, same with the towels. You donâ€™t expect this at a Marriot. The room was clean but old and uncomfortable. This hotel is advertised as 3-4stars but it is no way even close. It was like staying at a decent motel. However the price of $150.00 per night is insane for this place. It is not worth half that price. I stayed at 4Seasons last year for the same price in a much better hotel in a better location. Location is ok but nothing to write home about, you are better off staying on Sherbrooke between University and St. Laurent. There was always street parking available nearby so that is a plus. it was also nice to have a balcony, but it was not very useful since they dont even have any chairs or anything out there and you cant even smoke cigarettes on the balcony. I am not a smoker but it seemed like a strange rule for an outdoor balcony Overall it is a decent motel experience but really bad for the value. For 150 a night, I expect way better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever...Ever”
Reviews.Author: Azooooor
Reviews.Content: I personally prefer to stay at the Residence Inn (Business or Leisure). This was the worst hotel I have stayed at so far. Our stay started with the horrible parking experience. There were about 10 parking spots per floor in the underground parking. I had to wait there for about half an hour to find an empty spot. Then there was the elevator wait. I stood by the elevator for 15 min every time for it to arrive(I was on the 7th floor and started using the stairs in and out after experiencing the same problem about 2 times). Then there was the room. The fridge was at least 20 years old with a loud squeaking noise. Old carpet with a nasty smell. The balcony was filthy with algae on the floor from the water leaking out of the air conditioner. The front doors squeaked. The thermostat did not work. There was no exhaust in the washroom. The sofa bed was the most uncomfortable nights sleep ever. And they charge $1 for every local call. Upon complaining about the above the response from the front desk was "We are working to make things better". They did not offer any fixing or regrets. Never again will I stay here. I travel quite a lot to MontrÃ©al. I would suggest the four points hotel (Same price much better service with the valet parking).

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LonesAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of the way - but close to the metro station. It was very reasonably priced and includes a fully equipped kitchen and a little balcony. The staff are really friendly and helpful - even to an English speaker like me. Very reasonable and comfortable,

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JB88fml
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Westmont recently for four nights. I was with my wife and 11 year old son. We got a special deal so the rate was very competitive, particularly because it includes a full hot buffet breakfast every day. The breakfast is not â€œbrunch at the Ritz Carltonâ€�, but it was always a nice start to our day. Our room was a suite with a fully equipped kitchen as well as a balcony offering a panorama of the city. It was clean and in very good condition. The hotel has a nice rooftop indoor pool which we used a couple of times. The parking garage with in/out privileges was another nice feature. The only complaint I share with others is the elevator situation in the hotel; there are only two and at peak times you may wait for up to five minutes to get one. I travel frequently and in general I am a big fan of Marriott, they are very customer focused and their product is very consistent, The Westmont is no exception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadaDonna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights recently. The room was neat and clean - we had a bedroom, living room, balcony and kitchen stocked with everything you'd need if you wanted to stay in and cook. The breakfast was wonderful - hot and cold food, lots of variety and nicely laid out. The staff were very friendly and helpful - the front desk recommended several nearby restaurants - we tried two and they were great. It's located in a very pleasant neighbourhood. The metro is only two blocks away, and from there you can get anywhere in Montreal quickly and efficiently. Old Montreal and China town are ten minutes away by Metro, and the botanical gardens about twenty minutes away. Overall - a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: mike_22101
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with excellent service. Right near Attwater subway and huge shopping centres, its close enough to the city and restaurants. The service is fantastic and we enjoyed a great apartment with kitchenette and spacious surroundings. We would recommend this hotel for its functional rooms, great staff, good breakfasts and position.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but OLD and not close to anything”
Reviews.Author: euroguy99
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, but the elevator was not working for a while, and there is only one computer downstairs to use for internet. Room was clean and nice... but you can tell the hotel is OLD. When I flush the toilet the sink does not have cold water until the toilet fills up. And this hotel is not close to the good stuff in Montreal, so look for other hotels if you want to be close to all the big events in Montreal. I paid $149, would only stay here again for $120 tops.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK - family with young children”
Reviews.Author: lagotic
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lovely lobby and a wonderful breakfast. The staff were very nice. The room we were in was in bad need of renovation, though. It smelled of smoke (gross!!!) even though it was supposedly non-smoking. The rooms were redecorated maybe in the 80s, so things look a bit tired and old there. Also the toilet kept clogging. All the thresholds of the doors we saw had these huge bump-like lips, making them difficult to traverse with a stroller (and I'll bet a wheelchair too). Wheelchair accessible door button did not work from outside the hotel, either.

Reviews.Title: “Good apartment style hotel”
Reviews.Author: azntraveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel multiple times for business and it is a nice apartment style hotel. There have been times when the room that I was given had problems with hot water. I mentioned this and was told to keep the water running for awhile. Othertimes there weren't any problems with the hot water. The reception desk will call you about 30 minutes after you check in to verify that everything is okay. This is the only hotel that I've stayed at which does this. The gym is okay (1 treadmill, 1 stairmaster, free weights). Being an apartment style hotel, it has a full size fridge (with freezer), a stove, utensils, pots, microwave, dish washer, etc. which I find to be very useful. They sometimes have free early evening snacks depending on the day (schedule posted on fridge). The free breakfast buffet is very good. The parking is indoor (pay $) and underneath the hotel (accessible from hotel without exiting). The parking allows for multiple ins/outs and you pay per day/stay. The hotel is located in a quiet 1 way side street at the outer edge of downtown (near westmount). It is considered to be downtown for all intensive purposes. The hotel is completely non-smoking. The free internet is wired.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: shakkazulu
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Residence Inn in Westmount for two nights on business. I am from Montreal originally and know the area well. The location is very good, being close enough to downtown without being "too" close. It is on a quiet sidestreet and although the building looks fairly ordinary (cement highrise) the interiors are spotless. Check in was fast and efficient, and the rate of $129 / night was more than reasonable considering what other downtown hotels charge. Their underground parking is for small cars only (they warn you about this), and there is plenty of street parking nearby which is free from 8 pm to 9 am. I would save the $$$ and park on the street. The rooms are very well kept, with full kitchenettes (a microwave, a range and a fridge). The only minor issue was with the noise level of the AC, which could be better. But it was not something that kept me awake. The hot breakfast (included) is outstanding and far superior to the usual boring fare. Very good quality buffet-style food, with yogourts, breads, cereals, etc. Top notch. This is not a "luxury" hotel, but is an excellent value. I will certainly stay there again and highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property”
Reviews.Author: Twinaisle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property Jan 5-9, 2007. The location is a little ways out from the "tourist" areas, but it was not a bad walk to Rue St Catherine or Blvd Maisonneuve were one could find plenty of restaurants and shops. The metro (which gets you to many sites in the city) was only 2 blocks from the hotel. The neighborhood is not beautiful but encountered no problems, hotel exterior is blah but the lobby/public areas are very comfortable. Checkin/out was very quick and efficient, the hotel personel were very friendly - greeted everyone in English & French and then in the guests language on subsiquent meetings. The room was basic - but all I need is a good bed and a bathroom. The room had those plus a balcony and a fully equiped kichen. Our room was next to the elevator but the bathroom blocked any noise from it "entering" the rest of the room. It was nice to have the option of the buffet breakfast - the menu was scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage, waffles, a variety of cereals, fruit, yogurt, and breads/pastries. Very good selection. The pool was on the top floor and very nice (on a clear day probably had a great view). Will definately stay at this property on future visits to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Guy-R
Reviews.Content: when i arrived at the hotel in MontrÃ©al i was greeted by the housekeeping staff on strike... apon checking in the hotel and arriving in the room i open the curtains and to my shock there was dirt on the outside of the window (there were doing renovations on the balcony) breakfast was good the staff was not very helpful at all sent me in the wrong area twice when i received the proper directions the front desk manager i was quite pleasant and gave me the directions for the area I was looking for. I will say this staff over all was exactly was I expected in a Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not really a hotel”
Reviews.Author: suite
Reviews.Content: I have to say first that the Residence Inn was once a medium sized apartment building that has been converted into a hotel. So, keep that in mind. First, the hotel is very clean; rooms, foyer, etc. I never saw any problems whatsoever, and I like rooms clean! My friend stayed there 3 years ago, and I stayed there (with same friend) in July 2006. I'm not too sure about the $175 cdn per night, think it could be more like $120? The lobby is just like in the pictures. As mentioned by others, there are only 2 elevators, so you may have to wait a little bit, but not terrible. The free breakfast wasn't bad. My friend mentioned that is was a continental breakfast, but there was cereal, yogurt, small pancakes, sausage patties, scrambled eggs, bread, bagels, juice, tea and coffee. You could eat here no problem, but the pancakes were a little dry and flat :( They also have free hors-d'oeuvres about 4 nights during the week. One night they had chicken nuggets, salad, mini quiche, bread rolls, juice, and coffee/tea. So, having said that, I will say that if you are used to big name hotels that have the nice buffet set out, looking all pretty, you will not find it at the Residence. It is much more casual fare, something you may throw together for yourself and your kids if your were at home, but still laid out okay. The room in which they serve the food is small, and can be a bit noisy. There are a number of tables out in the lobby area, which are more quiet, and cooler. We had a room on the 14th floor, which was clean and bright. The furniture was clean, did not appear well used at all, and was comfortable. I slept in the king size bed in the bedroom, and my friend slept on the pull out couch. You have to make up the bed in the pull out, so be prepared for that--bed stuff is in the hall closet. I read stuff about the A/C being loud, but you know, that is with a lot of hotels, but not the big name ones. It wasn't extremely loud, but it reminded me of when my family and friends have stayed in motels with window A/C, so it is about that noise level, but it didn't bother us. There was plenty of space to put away clothing, etc. There is large closet in bedroom, along with drawers in chest. Also chest of drawers in living room in front of pull out couch. The kitchen is great, having all utensils, plates, pots, etc for you. Great size fridge, but microwave probably should be replaced. Stove was older, but very clean. There is a balcony for each hotel room, but, it is a standard apartment balcony, with no chairs or anything, and there is some water which is just from the air conditioner unit. Also, people may go out there to smoke, and our balcony had not been cleaned of cigarette butts.
